alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:35PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, central Baker, southwestern Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Macclenny, or 14 miles northeast of Raiford, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, penny size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Cecil Field, Maxville, Bryceville, Baldwin and Whitehouse Air Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
